radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderately inflated lungs with subcentimeter, faint nodular opacities in the upper lung zones.

Diffuse sub-pleural reticulation, bilateral scattered solid pulmonary nodules (3 to 6 mm), mild enlargement of a right hilar lymph node (14 mm) and low right paratracheal lymph node (11 mm). Aortic and coronary atherosclerosis present.
Opacification of the right frontal sinus but no evidence of sinusitis.

Persistent diffuse subpleural reticular opacities, new bilateral traction bronchiolectasis, new dilatation of the main pulmonary artery (33 mm), enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes, new ill-defined ground-glass opacities, and mild air trapping.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of new traction bronchiolectasis and enlargement of mediastinal lymph nodes compared to previous CT.

radiographic_examinations.date: Four months after the current evaluation
radiographic_examinations.findings: Progression of bilateral subpleural reticular opacities and traction bronchiectasis without mature honeycombing.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression noted compared to previous CT findings.
